title: Riot: Have you ever considered renaming older skins?
body:
Edit: Apparently Concepts & Creations is not the forum to ask about skins.  I guess that's obvious.

I ask this because some older skins don't seem to fit the theme that newer skins of similar names fall under. 

Let's take Forsaken Olaf and Forsaken Jayce. Jayce looks like a Sith Lord with a hammer. Olaf on the other hand just looks like Olaf with a recolor. 

Edit: Pictures for reference.

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VZ21FGdBOw4/hqdefault.jpg

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/d/d2/Olaf_ForsakenSkin_Ch.jpg/revision/latest/zoom-crop/width/613/height/460?cb=20110223135617

Then we have the Vandal skin line, where Brand, Twitch, Vlad, and Gragas look like modern bikers while Jax is in blue. 

Edit: Pictures for reference.

http://www.leagueoflegendsskins.com/images/champions/splash/Jax_2.jpg

http://pm1.narvii.com/5780/532d6e6c1b0d71ba71ec44d16f2d921e7828ac27_hq.jpg

I'm sure there are other examples I could give, but I can't think of them at the moment. 

So have you ever considered renaming a skin to make it fit or because it doesn't fit in a current skin line?

Edit: Shen's rework is actually a great time to try this out.  

Check out frozen Shen: 
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CZHvmmwWcAA3bCK.jpg

Then check out Frostblade Irelia:
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/HAoBCFfQ2Xk/maxresdefault.jpg

Now granted the main common factors between these two are ice themes, but that doesn't mean they can't both be in the same skin line ({{champion:59}} and {{champion:67}} are a part of the dragonslayer line despite their skins not looking similar to {{champion:201}} and {{champion:80}} in terms of color after all).  

And since Shen is fighting Zed in this splash art, you could have the shockblade skin line be rivals to the frost blade skin line.  Sort of like the Marauders and Wardens or Dragonslayers vs Dragon Tamers.

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/l2Q-Pn1jZvM/maxresdefault.jpg

Ice vs Lighting!  Two forces of the storm clashing in a hurricane of strife.

replies.body:
Actually yes, I bring it up on the team from time to time. I'm not sure what the pros and cons are, and we are generally very careful when making any changes to skins that players have already purchased, but I suggest it when something like the RPG skins are coming out and I want to rename Rugged Garen to have a name like the others. I expect players would have mixed feelings about that though so for now we let them be.

On the other hand when reworks do come around I like to bring those old skins into the thematic fold. For example if Forsaken Olaf was reworked I might want to try giving him a hood and some glowing red axes.

On one hand, that would be a huge change for the Olaf skin.

On the other hand red lightaxesabersthings on a viking is just brutal af.
I'd be fine with that.

IKR!!! As if he wasn't savage enough xD
I guess that's what surveys are for. You could just ask the players.
We have super smart data analysts running all sorts of surveys every day! It's an excellent tool because it can gather data from our entire playerbase across all regions and demographics.
Ex-actly. So just ask us and see if we are cool with it.
Thank you for responding. Honestly the recolors you could make as free chroma's for the players that already have those skins.
We could, but is it not much much more awesome when your favourite champion has new life breathed into all their old skins? I think it's well worth the time!

I think people are way less attached to the name than to the theme.
Although Sith Axedude is definitely an improvement over glow-eyed recolor.

I guess considering it's a recolour I'm not sure what the intended theme was, or what players think of it as. Chances are players have a lot of different ideas about what Forsaken Olaf is - which makes it tricky.

>
> On the other hand when reworks do come around I like to bring those old skins into the thematic fold. For example if Forsaken Olaf was reworked I might want to try giving him a hood and some glowing red axes.

I do like this idea, don't get me wrong, but are you sure the eCommerce department would like it if you turned a 520 RP recolor into something worth significantly more?

That's a fair point, but looking at the Shen skins I think there's a lot we could do. I feel like concept artists are guilty of pushing projects as much as we can and getting a little over-ambitious >x)
weird, i dont think they almost ever go far off of the basic model.... originality is not something i would attribute to some of the skins we have available
You retexture skins all the time so i dont see renaming them as much different.

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6nmpn8Ew,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-20T09:05:22.491+0000)

> Actually yes, I bring it up on the team from time to time. I'm not sure what the pros and cons are, and we are generally very careful when making any changes to skins that players have already purchased, but I suggest it when something like the RPG skins are coming out and I want to rename Rugged Garen to have a name like the others. I expect players would have mixed feelings about that though so for now we let them be.
> 
> On the other hand when reworks do come around I like to bring those old skins into the thematic fold. For example if Forsaken Olaf was reworked I might want to try giving him a hood and some glowing red axes.

So does this also mean that Full Metal Pantheon will thematically look more like Full Metal Jayce once his VU comes along. And Rammus, he has a Full Metal skin, but it doesnt quite thematically fit with Jayces.

Potentially if we felt like it would be cool for players who already have the skin. As people in this thread are mentioning, the most important thing is to retain the core fantasy of the skin that players like. With recolours this is very vague so there's probably more space to do something fresh, while something like Full Metal Pantheon has a clearer established theme. I think looking at previous reworks like Miss Fortune and Gangplank is a good guide where themes were preserved but designs were in some instances changed a fair bit.

Yeah I also think that it would make sense to rename some other skins so that they actually fit another skin theme.

For example Bandito fiddlesticks could be renamed into High-noon-fiddlesticks(or high noon jhin could become bandito jhin?)
Reworked olaf confirmed
Vandal {{champion:24}} is not related with the skin line, happens to be that the skin got named that way..according to a rioter
True, but why not rename it?

I find Mecha Kha'Zix to not fit the Mecha line at all, especially if you upgrade his ultimate. After that it takes on the red appearance of the Battlecast skin line.

I also find Battlecast Xerath to not fit the line at all. Not even the red recolor can replace the fact it's supposed to be ballistic or offensive tech inspired weaponry being used, such as missiles or soundwaves.
Riot has renamed skins before. Pentakill Karthus was named Deathsinger Karthus before the Pentakill line became a thing.

Yes, I've considered it before. Many times.

Just don't ask me which ones; I can't recall them off the top of my head.
It be nice, maybe then they can change Bandito Fiddlesticks skin into High Noon Fiddlesticks, I feel like that name would fit him better.
